entry.title: Cloaca (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that, according to the artist, the Cloaca art installations (example pictured) are "shit machines"?

entry.title: 1999 Tempe military base shooting (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after the 1999 Tempe military base shooting, the Pan African Congress demanded a military funeral for the perpetrator?

entry.title: Carachipampa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the volcano Carachipampa is surrounded by a lake and a salt flat, and has a Mars-like environment?

entry.title: a Stone Age Siberian village (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Stone Age Siberian village is the oldest known fortification in the world?

entry.title: Jenny Cavnar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jenny Cavnar is the first female primary play-by-play announcer in Major League Baseball history?

entry.title: black-capped chickadee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the hippocampus of the black-capped chickadee grows in the fall and shrinks in the spring?

entry.title: a commissioner of the Baltimore Police Department (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a great-grandfather and a grandfather of a commissioner of the Baltimore Police Department also served in the department?

entry.title: French views of widespread homosexuality among Ottoman Turks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that due to 19th-century French views of widespread homosexuality among Ottoman Turks, Mehmet Cemaleddin Efendi was offered male prostitutes by officials on a visit to Paris?
